Entalpic

AI & materials research for a fair and ecological transition.

Learn more

(We are hiring!)

Entalpic is in for the long run.

Entalpic's mission is to leverage artificial intelligence to accelerate the development of new materials and chemical processes for a fair and ecological transition. We are a team of scientists and engineers with a passion for innovation and sustainability.

Our goal is to provide the tools and expertise needed to design and optimize materials and chemicals with improved performance and reduced environmental impact. We believe that AI can help us to create a more sustainable future for all.

We are currently in stealth mode but welcome collaborations and partnerships. If you are interested in working with us, please get in touch !

Founders

Mathieu Galtier is Entalpic's CEO. With 10 years of experience in startups, including 6 at Owkin, he is passionate about AI and its applications in healthcare and sustainability. He holds a PhD in Maths and Neuroscience and a MSc in Computer Science from the ENS Ulm.

Victor Schmidt is Entalpic's CTO. He is a dedicated engineer from École polytechnique (Paris) with a PhD in AI applied to climate change mitigation from Université de Montréal (supervised by Yoshua Bengio).

Alexandre Duval is Entalpic's CS(cience)O. He has a renowned experitise in Graph Machine Learning and its applications to materials science. He holds a PhD in Machine Learning from École Centrale Paris & INRIA.

We are hiring!

We are looking for talented individuals to join our team. If you are passionate about AI, sustainability, and innovation, we want to hear from you!

Current positions available: Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, Software Engineer, Research Scientist, and more.

Apply now!

Research

Here is a list of papers related to Entalpic's research interests.

Some of them we are authors on, some others are just cool papers we like. Enjoy!

Graph Neural Networks for Materials Informatics: Challenges, Applications, and Best Practices

This paper reviews the state-of-the-art of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in materials informatics, focusing on the challenges, applications, and best practices.

Graph Neural Networks for Materials Informatics: Challenges, Applications, and Best Practices

This paper reviews the state-of-the-art of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in materials informatics, focusing on the challenges, applications, and best practices.
